questions.question_text: An engineer is importing users into Cisco Unity Connection using AXL and discovers that some users are not listed in the import view. Which action should be taken to resolve this issue?

choices.D: Configure the user primary extension to their directory number.
choices.C: Configure the username and password in LDAP.
choices.A: Configure the user access control group assignment to Standard CTI Enabled.
choices.B: Configure the user digest credentials to match the user password.

questions.question_text: Users report that they are unable to check voicemail, and an engineer discovers that the voicemail system is not routing calls between Cisco Unity Connection and Cisco UCM via SCCP. Which action should be taken to resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A and B are for SIP Protocol. C VM ports are not called CTI ports.
Answer: D (keyword "not routing")

Selected Answer: C
A, B and D make no sense to me... I'd go with C
"Troubleshooting Call Control
Use the following troubleshooting information if the phone system integration has problems related to call control. Do the following tasks, as applicable: Use the Check Telephony Configuration test.
Using the Check Telephony Configuration Test
You can use the Check Telephony Configuration test to troubleshoot the phone system integration. For example, use this test if the following conditions exist:
Calls to Unity Connection are failing.
Ports are failing to register."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/connection/15/troubleshooting/guide/b_15cuctsg/b_15cuctsg_chapter_01101.html#ID-2411-00000023

choices.C: Verify registration of the CTI ports.
choices.D: Verify Calling Search Space in the Directory Number setting.
choices.A: Verify voicemail SIP trunk in the route list.
choices.B: Verify OPTIONS Ping in the SIP trunk profile.

discussion.content:
Sorry, C is correct, 
Release to Switch—Unity Connection puts the caller on hold, dials the extension, and releases the call to the phone system. When the line is busy or is not answered, the phone system—not Unity Connection—forwards the call to the user or handler greeting. This transfer type allows Unity Connection to process incoming calls more quickly. Use Release to Switch only when call forwarding is enabled on the phone system

I will go for B,
Select the number of times the extension rings before Unity Connection plays the user or handler greeting.

Set this value to at least three to give users a chance to answer. Avoid setting to more than four, especially if the call may be transferred to another extension, where the caller might have to wait for another set of rings. This value should be at least two rings fewer than the phone system setting for forwarding calls.

questions.question_text: A user complains that incoming calls are being forwarded to another extension before being transferred to voicemail. The user expects calls to be transferred to their voicemail faster if they do not answer the phone. The administrator is managing calls with the supervised transfer option on a Cisco Unity Connection call handler. What should the administrator change to resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
